abstract: Allianz is on the look out for acquisitions, putting aside a budget of 1 billion euros ($1.4 billion) with which it hopes to buy up general insurers once regulations become more clear, Michael Diekmann, the German insurer’s chief executive, told The Financial Times.
snippet: Allianz is on the look out for acquisitions, putting aside a budget of 1 billion euros ($1.4 billion) with which it hopes to buy up general insurers once regulations become more clear, Michael Diekmann, the German insurer’s chief executive, told T...
lead_paragraph: Allianz, the German insurer, is on the lookout for acquisitions, putting aside a budget of 1 billion euros ($1.4 billion) with which it hopes to buy up general insurers once regulations become clearer, Michael Diekmann, the company’s chief executive, told The Financial Times.

headline.main: Allianz Builds Up $1.4 Billion Deal Fund
